Posts.Content: Apr 22, 2011 09:56AM cmesker wrote: I just had a lumpectomy/slnb on 4/14/11.  My lumpectomy incision doesn't bother me at all as long as I wear a bra, however the node area is very sensitive, mostly due to the unfortunate location and the nipple area is very sensitive due to the injections for the node dye.  However today it's feeling really good and I drove yesterday for my post-op checkup with no problem.  Two days ago I was wondering if it would ever get better, and then today and yesterday have given me hope!   I have the benefit of owning my own business so I work at home anyway, on a computer, and started getting back to work on Monday.  I don't have stitches, just the seri-strips and I think they are half of what is driving me nuts.  I did take an hour and a half trip to my grandmother's and we shopped all day on Wednesday and by the time I got home I could barely stay awake, but even two days later it seems to be better.   Since it's been 2 days now since you posted, I hope you are feeling much better today!
Posts.Title: post-lumpectomy -how long should it be sore? Melmes doxie

Posts.Content: Apr 22, 2011 11:53AM cmesker wrote: Hello fine ladies!  I'm also joining the May rads group.  I have my radiation therapy consult on May 3 and expect to start the treatment shortly thereafter.  Looking forward to having a group to talk with during that time.  I've been lurking around since my diagnosis two months ago and just had surgery last week, but this is the first day I've made any posts here.  Figured I may as well jump in and join in when I can!
Posts.Title: May 2011 Radiation Pinkprincess GabbyCal
